title: Closing of Executive Departments and Agencies of the Federal Government on Friday, December 26, 2014

enrichment.summary: This executive order officially closes all executive branch departments and agencies on December 26, 2014, the day after Christmas, excusing employees from work unless their presence is required for national security, defense, or other essential needs. It also clarifies how pay and leave should be handled for that day and directs the Office of Personnel Management to implement the order.
potential_concerns: The orderâ€™s exception for employees deemed essential for national security or defense may lead to inconsistent application across agencies, causing confusion and potential morale issues among federal employees required to work on December 26.
Federal employees excused from duty but still compensated may raise concerns about equitable pay policies and leave accrual under EO 11582 and related statutes.

Limited guidance on what constitutes 'other public need' may result in discretionary and uneven determinations by agency heads, potentially creating perceptions of unfair treatment among federal employees.
Employees working on the closed day may face challenges balancing personal time with work obligations, possibly impacting job satisfaction and work-life balance.
